text:
Merging deals via API is not possible, yes? I mean, no?

NM, the deal would be unenrolled in the workflow resulting in an error, how it works now is I update the old deal and then archive the "new" one (actually same deal but updated data via integration and doing PATCH stuff in the other end is not feasible because need to map other end's status to dealstage etc.) which also results in the workflow erroring b/c the enrolled deal got deleted so it's not exactly _optimal_ but hey
Is it possible there’s a limit to the number of properties on a custom object? If someone from the HS team can look into this, the custom object is `p20997640_course`
Hello everyone!!! I want to show the views of my blog on the front end. Can anyone help me with it?

All, we are using the Events email API and it seems the campaignid filter is not working.

e.g. the response for both these requests disregards the campaignid filter, returning events for all campaigns
1. <https://api.hubapi.com/email/public/v1/events?hapikey=xxxxxxxxxxxxxx&limit=1000&randomstring=xxxxx&eventType=OPEN&offset>  
2. <https://api.hubapi.com/email/public/v1/events?hapikey=xxxxxxxxxxxxxx&limit=1000&campaignid=xxxxx&eventType=OPEN&offset> 
In the 1st request, we are replacing the request parameter with an arbitrary string and the API seems to be ignoring that.

HubSpot's own documentation  <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/email/get_events> has a similar sample request <https://api.hubapi.com/email/public/v1/events?hapikey=demo&campaignId=13054799&appId=20185>


Is this a bug or am I missing something?


Thank you

Any tracking code/events API experts here? Is there any safe way to add events to custom objects as well through the custom behavioral event (JS)? Or is the only way through REST API calls from the tracking code, which sounds a bit unsafe.
